turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What evidence?

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: For one thing there were no skid marks on that bridge, the tires were all intact, from what we could tell, nothing wrong internally with the vehicle either. Like the car had been driven off the bridge intentionally.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: It should all in the report. I told you guys everything. She was giving birth in the fucking car. She grabbed the wheel and I lost control.

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: I did read that, yes.  What hospital were you going to? I mean the Lodovico Street Bridge isn't exactly on the way to Mercy General.

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: Sorry I'm in your seat aren't I?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: No please make yourself at home.

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: I thought you loved games.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I'll just stay out of this conversation until you come out and tell me why you've disrupted me at work.

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: You and your wife were playing a game shortly before you got into that car accident weren't you?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Where is she? Where is my wife?

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: Sorry to take up your time like that Trevor. Don't work too hard. Oh, before I forget. I talked your neighbor out of pressing charges.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: The whackjob in the black lipstick who lives down the hall? She wanted you arrested for harassment. I told her to chill out and smoke a joint. I'd look the other way as long as she did you know?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: We're all here for you Trevor.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Morgue...?

turns.speaker: LANGE
turns.text: That's right Trevor. The timing was impeccable wasn't it? It's been eight months two weeks and three days but we finally found the body. Just need you to ID it for us.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Look Larry I know you never thought too much of me. And I know this all sounds a little fucked up.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: A little? Try unbelievably.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I swear these guys are like playing mindgames with me. I think they got a hold of my e-mail address at work too.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Trevor barring the more outrageous aspects of your claim you are not the only widower the police have questioned when foul play is suspected.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Hey ninety five point three percent of all murders are committed by either a spouse, a direct relative or a close friend that's common knowledge. But this wasn't murder it was an accident-

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: And as far as hiding a body goes? I find it hard to believe even the dirtiest of cops would keep a victim's remains hidden simply to get someone to confess. It's absolutely preposterous. Now I'm not saying I don't believe you, I'm....ambiguous. There's quite alot of money behind all this.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: How much do I stand to inherit if Kirsty is presumed dead?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What happens if I'm convicted of Kirsty's murder?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Well they'd have to prove it in a court of law for one thing-

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Please Larry. Pretend you like me and humor me.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Seeing you were her sole benefactor, and I'm the executive of the will, Kirsty's entire estate would have to be donated to the city.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Hello? City? Cops? It's a fucking conspiracy!

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Pardon my glibness Trevor but you sound like a raving lunatic. The next time you seek counsel it should be of the psychiatric type. You're obviously on the verge of some nervous collapse.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Thanks for your concern Larry. And fuck you too.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Least let me finish will ya? Got one puff left.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I don't work here.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Music to my ears.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Hey buddy!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: ... but I'm starting to think I was... I was going to...

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Hey buddy!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What do you want?!

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Who the hell are you talking to?

turns.speaker: PARAMEDIC
turns.text: Do you know where you are?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Ambulance.

turns.speaker: PARAMEDIC
turns.text: We're just gonna take some blood here.

turns.speaker: PARAMEDIC
turns.text: Okay how many fingers am I holding up?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: PARAMEDIC
turns.text: Can you follow them?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: You mean... when the car went off the bridge?

turns.speaker: PARAMEDIC
turns.text: Wow you are out of it.

turns.speaker: PINHEAD
turns.text: Poor Trevor.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: This game is over do you hear me?

turns.speaker: PINHEAD
turns.text: I hear everything. And soon you will know everything. More than you ever wanted I can guarantee that. But I want you to think for a minute first. Think about all you've seen. All the clues you've been given.

turns.speaker: PINHEAD
turns.text: How is our little student doing? Has he learned his lesson yet?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I don't know who you are or what you want. I just want to know what's under that sheet...

turns.speaker: PINHEAD
turns.text: Use your mind for something other than numbers dear Trevor. Think about people for a change. People other than yourself. Like the women you slept with behind your wife's back. You were always so confident you had covered your tracks. Always confident your wife actually believed your fervent denials? Part of you must have known she would find out.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What's under that sheet...?

turns.speaker: PINHEAD
turns.text: You probably don't remember the night we played. Your first year as husband and wife.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I don't know what I'm doing here. I'm not even Catholic. I just had to tell somebody. It's like, ever since my wife died I don't know what I've actually done or what I've imagined. But I do know if one tenth of what's happening to me is reality... I've done some really awful things in my life. Things that I've... I guess I've blocked out...

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: What things do you think you've done?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Wow. Let's see. So many sins so little time. For starters I was responsible for the death my wife who by the way was carrying my unborn child. That was so I could collect her eight million dollar estate. I think I killed several women I was having mindless sex with behind her back.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: But I saw these women. I saw their mutilated bodies. I saw their ghosts. I just know it happened I can feel it...

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: All you've got is the here and the now Trevor. That's all anyone really has. Maybe this will make things easier to understand. A man goes to sleep every night and has recurring dream that he's a butterfly. In time he begins to wonder if he might actually be a butterfly who dreams he's a man. And at the end of the day does it even matter? All these events you're describing. How can you be sure any of them really happened?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: But that's what I need. To be sure... to be absolutely sure...

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Shh. It's okay son. There is but one truth. One thing you can be absolutely sure of. And that thing is this:

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: Dreams?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I was going to say dimensions. But I guess technically they are dreams.

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: You should always listen to your subconscious. It's trying to tell you something about your waking life.

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: Trevor your body has been completely healed. All the nerve endings have repaired themselves. If there is any pain in your head it's... in your head.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Jeez it's getting awful crowded in there.

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: My teacher told me once there's a puncture point on your body that can lock your soul within it, even after you're dead. So that when you die you're trapped inside your body, watching it corrode for all eternity.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Look, whatever your Marharagi, told you, forget. You've got to get this fuckin pain to stop.

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: It was an analogy. Your soul is locked up inside you. You need to free it Trevor. You've blocked it from the healing process. That's what we need to do now. Heal your soul. And to do that I you have to give in utterly and without any hesitation or doubt. Do you know what I mean by giving in? It's about trust. Do you trust me implicitly?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I don't even know what's real and what isn't how can I trust anyone?

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: You can trust me. Your wife is dead and you need to move past that. And the only way to move past something completely is to go straight through it, not around it. Surrender yourself to your wife's death. Let it chew you up and spit you back out on the other side. It's the only way you can become whole again.

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: Are you ready?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I surrender...

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Wait... what the hell is this...

turns.speaker: SAGE
turns.text: Surrender yourself... surrender yourself...

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: ... knock on my door, I'm a total insomniac.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: No, thanks I've got a... a date tonight-

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: -Tawny.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Whew. You bounce right back don't you?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Last week...

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: The car accident? Any of this ringing a bell?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: It's not that kind of date.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Hey even if it is more power to ya.  Alrighty then. Have a good time.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Hey. Can I borrow something?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Uh... sure, Tawny... what?

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Tawny? What's- what are you doing?

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: YOU!

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I'm, uh, not sure... Feeling kind of weird actually.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: I'm kinda feeling nuts myself!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I've never said this to a woman before but can't we talk a little bit before grabbing at each other?

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: God. Sometimes you can be such an animal. Other times you are the ultimate tease...

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Wow. That's good. Lots of capers, huh?

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: For starters. It's also got fennel, asparagus, olives, some more of mother nature's aphrodisiacs... Back in college, me and my roommates used to call it hard- on stew.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: If you ever smelled this coming from our dorm room, you knew one of us was in there getting laid.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: You must have been very proud of yourselves...

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: It's getting hot in here.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Tawny I think I'm going to be sick.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Well now there's a compliment.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Whoa, I have serious space issues, dude. What do you want?

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I... think we need to talk, there's something really strange going on...

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: Hey you're the guy from down the hall.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Come on, quit fucking around. Listen it's about... what we did together last night.

turns.speaker: TAWNY
turns.text: WHAT?!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: And you pulled people out? You're...  a hero.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Nah, I fucked it up.  I was tryin' to impress this kid, don't ask me why.  I was gonna rescue his old man, but I couldn't find the poor bastard.  He musta blew up.  I got the hell outta there.  I didn't have the nerve to face the kid.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: A lotta people wouldn't have tried. It was pretty brave even trying...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Try stupid.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You got a drinking problem or what?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I sell them at the recycling center. Gives me a little for gas and food.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Looks like you live in here, for Chrissake!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: In bad weather, yeah.  Mostly I camp out in the woods.  I thought maybe you were down on your luck too when I picked you up.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You should give it to someone with only one leg.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: One leg!  Like the Red Cross or something?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I know a guy who only has one leg.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Sell it to him.  You get a couple bucks, it pays for the ride.  I got a job, nice apartment.  I do okay.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: They interview you or anything? At the plane crash?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey, do I look crazy?  I don't go for that shit... interviews, media. They're manipulators.  "Keep a low profile," that's my motto.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey, Bubber, c'mere!  I gotta talk to you, buddy.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: LaPlante!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Come on, John, don't be an asshole. I don't like heights.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I just wanna talk with you for a minute.  Then you can jump.  You can jump twice for all I care.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Talk from there.  You can talk from there.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: In private.  They got cameras and alla that crap in there. Microphones.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: That's for Ga... Ms. Gayley.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: What am I, a goddamn postman?  I'm way the fuck up here, I'm scared a heights, and you want me to deliver a letter?  Put a stamp on it for Chrissake!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: That's close enough.  It's a confession.  The truth.  Jesus, I'm sorry, LaPlante.  I had the shoe, you said you didn't want, publicity because of your legal problems.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I don't recall saying I didn't want a million bucks...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I never really thought they'd go for it.  And then... you didn't come forward, they investigated my war record...  I kept expecting you to show up and expose me...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I was in the can, for Chrissake.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: The bathroom!  For two days?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Jail!  Listen, Bubber...  This is crazy.  We could fall off of here.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You should go in.  You're risking your life again...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I'm beginning to... be aware of that, John.  Listen, I'm not gonna do nothing heroic here, you can trust me on that, buddy.  Whaddaya say we just sit down for a while. I don't have no tricks, I'm not that smart.  You could, like, rest up for the jump.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: What have I done?  I was dirt poor and useless... but I was honest.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Lighten up, John.  You think <u>you</u> got problems for Chrissake?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You stole her purse!  While you were saving her?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: What's the big deal?  You decided to pretend you were me.  A little moment of weakness, right?  So I sorta swiped her purse.  I got feet of clay too, bUddy.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: And she thinks you're blackmailing me?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Which don't sound like such a bad goddamn idea, John.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Huh?  Whadda you mean?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Well, we gotta work this thing out, John.  It's a goddamn mess an' I'm halfway to doing serious time in the joint an' the TV lady's so stuck on you she don't want it to come out you stole her purse because it might break the heart of millions.  Looka those maniacs, willya?  They love you, for Chrissake!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I don't need to be a hero, LaPlante, but I can't face people... the looks in their eyes... after the trust they gave me!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Great!  You make this big goddamn mess, then ya jump.  Beautiful! Listen, John, I was there at the hospital today, I seen you with those little bastards .

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: It was you!  I thought I heard...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I'm not saying I hate sick people or anything but I hate being <u>around</u> them if you know what I mean.  There <u>you</u> go, you <u>inspire</u> this kid to <u>live</u>.  I probably woulda vomited on him.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Allen?  He... he's okay?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You got those people out of the plane, LaPlante, not me.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You <u>woulda</u> gone in there, you wouldn'ta thought twice...  Trust me on that, that's the kinda guy you are.  For a guy like me, it's a momentary loss of sanity.  I wasn't thinking clearly.  Listen, I'm no hero, John.  I just want some dough and maybe a little favor. How much didja spend already on all that do-gooder bullshit?  You didn't spend it <u>all</u> didja?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Well, I donated a lot to different causes, uh... La...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bernie.  Call me Bernie.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: --but there's a lot of it still left, uh, Bernie.  Almost half.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You got it?  Four year scholarship to a top college, plus Medical School or Law School or whatever Joey wants; pay off the $2,500 to my attorney, plus pay her fee in full, plus my annual consulting fee...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: And give a deposition to the jUdge.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Listen, John, you better double my attorney's fee.  She's very inexperienced, but she done a great job for me. And give her your autograph.  She thinks you're some kinda holy man.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: On the deposition for the jUdge, Bernie... I mean there's no way I can promise anything.  I can't tell him what we're up to...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You'll tell him I talked you out of jumping, right?  Just keep me outta prison.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I... I'll do the best I can, Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: That's good enough for me.  You better take that "letter" there and get rid of it.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I dunno.  It was... an impulse. Me, wearing my good shoes.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Same with me, pretending I was you. An impulse.  Why not?  I had this shoe.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: There was this kid there saying, "Go in there and save my father, mister." And I'm thinking about my boy Joey and this goddamn fireman my wife's seeing. It was like I was supposed to save myself.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Yeah, and with me it was like I was supposed to pretend the shoe was mine.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: So now you gotta wear it, you poor bastard.  Everyday you gotta be everybody's hero.  People watching you all the time.  Waiting for you to make...  a slip.  Slip up.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Looking... good, partner.  Hang in there.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Y-you're a g-god damn saint, John.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: What's going on?  "Guilty"!  What is this?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I got your bail continued.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bail, for Chrissake!  I'm innocent!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: "Anticipation of incarceration"?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: He means prison, Mr. LaPlante.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I know what he means.  I'm not a prison kinda guy, Miss O'Day.  I'm a goddamn working man for Chrissake!  Maybe I "augment" my income a little with some "business deals," maybe summa the guys I sell to are crooks, how would I know, I'm not an investigator.  You can't make it on a wage no more, not in this country.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I think our best course right now would be to focus on the Probation Officer's report...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: He gives a good report and I walk?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: We can hope.  You still have your job, right?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Yeah, I been calling in sick.  They think I got the flu.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: And a son by your ex-wife?  Joseph.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: A son, yeah.  What about him?  Joey.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Are you pretty involved in his upbringing?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Involved!  Christ!  She attached my goddamn paycheck!  Child support. Why do you think I can't afford a lawyer?  You know what I mean.  Why I got a court appointed lawyer instead of a, uh, more experienced...

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I understand.  How often do you see your son?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Often, uh.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: How recently?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Uh, his birthday, uh, May.  I think.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: It's November.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: She don't like me to see him. Says I'm a bad influence.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I think you should visit your son. And try and get your boss to write a note about your performance on the job.  You need to create the impression of a responsible, decent citizen with familial responsibilities who happened to slip up once.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Uh, I know you're having financial difficulties, Mister LaPlante, but I wonder if... I mean, the money I loaned you...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Some of it.  Right here.  I got some of it.  I'll get the rest as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: "The Angel of Flight 104!"  You're telling me you're the A...?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: "Angel!"  I didn't say "angel," that's a little strong.  Listen, here's the thing, I gotta get over there to the TV station to collect my million bucks.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Mister LaPlante, I really want to help you, but crazy stories are only going to make it worse.  The D.A. is asking your bail be set at twenty-five thousand dollars because you were arrested again while you were out on bail...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Twenty-five grand is peanuts!  All you gotta do is get me outta here long enough to collect.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Whaddaya mean they didn't reduce the bail?  If they didn't reduce it, how'dja spring me?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I took a loan on my car and my computer.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You whaaaaaat?  You paid it?  You gave a bondsman ten percent?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I was inspired by the hero, how he stuck his neck out for others, how he took a chance...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: That fake <u>inspired</u> you to loan a guy who's been fired off his job <u>twenty-five hundred</u> goddamn dollars? A guy you say is probably gonna <u>do</u> <u>time</u>!  You're s'posed to be an <u>attorney</u> for Chrissake!  You're s'posed to have <u>good judgment</u>!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Well, as you like to point out, Mister LaPlante, I'm relatively inexperienced.  My naivete may have worked to your benefit in this instance.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Listen, now that I owe you twenty-five hundred bucks plus, how about loaning me twenty for cab fare?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: So you can call me "naive," Mister LaPlante.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey, you could call me "Bernie," forget the "Mister LaPlante" stuff.  You are naive.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: I read the probation report.  It's not good.  I think you're going... going to prison, Mister... Bernie. I know that scares you but..

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: TAXI!  HEY, TAXI!  Well, at least I'm gonna get my goddamn million bucks.  TAXI FOR CHRISSAKE!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I seen on the TV where that do-gooder asshole's gonna go visit sick kids at three-thirty.  Children's Hospital, on the double.

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You mean John Bubber?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey!  Do I have a record?  Have I ever done time?  I mean I been arrested a few times, who hasn't? Parking tickets for Chrissake! Suspicion of stuff!  Have I ever been convicted of anything?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Mister LaPlante...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Take a look at my employment record, you got my employment record there, right?  You see any unemployment there, any welfare? I'm a taxpayer.  They eat me alive, the tax people, they got taxes on everything, taxes, taxes, taxes, and forms!  Taxes and forms so I can pay your goddamn salary, so you can sit there and write stuff, guys like me pay your wages...

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Mister LaPlante...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Do I hit anybody?  You see me shoot anybody?  Hey, drugs!  Do I sell drugs?  Jesus, I don't belong in prison.  I'm a family man.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Mister LaPlante...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Look, I got this kid.  We got a goddamn relationship!  I'm takin' him to a movie tonight!  He worships me.  If I go down what's this do to my son?  I'm his goddamn role model for Christ sake!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Some guys been looking for me, Chick?  Spanish kinda guys.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: Spanish kinda guys!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Business thing.  Gimme a seven and seven, willya?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: What is it, five days now I don't see you!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: 'Cause I'm up to my ass in shit is why.  I'm broke, plus I got legal problems... Nobody was asking for me, huh?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: Nope.  Legal problems, you gotta have a good attorney.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: My attorney, she's just outta law school, about a couple of years older than my kid, for Chrissake.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: You gotta kid?  How old's your kid?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Nine.  I think.  Maybe ten.  Yeah, ten.  Nice kid.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: You got a ten year old attorney, Bernie?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I can't afford no better.  My ex, she attached my pay check for child support payments.  You looking for Bernie LaPlante by any chance?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: I didn't even know you had a kid.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: The thing about kids is, they're so... young!  They don't know nothin' yet.  When you're a kid, you think you're gonna grow up an' be a "wonderful person" instead of an asshole, like everybody else.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: We're all assholes, Bernie?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: When I was a kid, I thought I was gonna be this fantastic wonderful heroic human being.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: Bernie, how'sa kid?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You don't wanna know, Chick, you don't wanna know.  Those guys been in here?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: You in business with those guys or what?  I wouldn't want a problem for the establishment, Bern.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You couldn't have a problem, Chick, because I personally have got them all.  I cornered the whole goddamn market.  You wouldn't believe... Oh, how ya doin'...?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey, I don't blame you for bein' sore.  I know I screwed up gettin' busted in here.  You got a right to throw me out.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: I'm not gonna throw you out, Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: What wouldja say if I toldja I ran into a burning plane an' saved a buncha people, Chick, an' risked my goddamnlife?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: You mean like Bubber?  The hero?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Yeah, like that.  Same thing.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: Well... I mean... what am I supposed to say here, Bern?  Is this a riddle or what?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I mean, if I said it, wouldja believe me?  Ya wouldn't, would ya?

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: It's a character thing, Bernie. I mean, you wouldn't do it.  No offense.  Me neither.  I mean, a guy like Bubber, he's a certain kinda guy.  Heroic.  You and me, we're not... heroic.  It's not our nature. It don't mean we're bad or nothing. We're just not so inclined.  What about it?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Nothin'.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: I wouldn't be depressed about it, Bern.  A guy don't have to be heroic to be a human being.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: The thing is, Chick.  I'm goin' down.

turns.speaker: CHICK
turns.text: Down.  You mean jail?  For that credit card stuff?  For Chrissake, Bernie, your lawyer...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bill, I...

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: DON'T SAY "BILL," BERNIE!  DON'T SAY ONE WORD!  DIDN'T I SAY "ONE WORD AND YOU'RE FIRED?"

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: YOU KNOW WHY?  BECAUSE IT'LL BE AN <u>EXCUSE</u>!  IT'LL BE "BERNIE LAPLANTE EXCUSE NUMBER FOUR THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED AND SIX."  NO, FOUR THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED AND TWELVE.  THAT'S HOW MANY EXCUSES YOU HAVE GIVEN ME, I KEEP TRACK OF THEM ELECTRONICALLY. I HEARD THEM ALL, BERNIE.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bill, I got some legal problems and I...

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: THAT'S IT!  YOU TALKED!  YOU'RE FIRED!  OUTTA HERE!  GET OUTTA HERE!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bill, listen...

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: OUT!  I TOLDJA.  JESUS CHRIST, I GOT CUSTOMERS WAITING!  AN' YOU WERE GONNA GO OUT LIKE THAT?  AN' MEET THE PUBLIC IN STOCKING-FUCKING-FEET?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bill, I got financial problems and...

turns.speaker: ROBINSON
turns.text: I DON'T CARE ABOUT <u>YOUR</u> PROBLEMS, I'M GONNA THINK ABOUT <u>MY</u> PROBLEMS. <u>YOU'RE</u> ONE A MY PROBLEMS.  GET OUT! OUT!  OUT!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He waited for you three hours!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You are not gonna believe this, Evelyn!  Absolutely fantastic!  I'm on my way --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I am so tired of your bullshit, Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Ev, it's not my fault!  I'm trying to tell you this incredible --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's never your fault, Bernie! Never ever!  You screwed up my life, now you're gonna screw up Joey's life, but you're never gonna accept responsibility for anyth--

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Is he here, your friend.  The fireman?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He had an emergency call... a <u>real</u> emergency.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Why doncha let me in so we don't wake everybody in the neighborhood?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Willya lemme talk for Chrissake? I'm trying to tell you what happened.  What happened is...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The same thing that always happens! You blew it! And this time you broke your son's heart instead of mine!  He was so proud, looking forward to going to a movie with his father... and you let him down!  Like you let everybody down, always!  What did you do, take a mudbath?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: That's what I'm trying to... to... okay, nevermind.  Just lemme talk to Joey to... to apologize.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He's in bed!  You're not gonna wake him and make him crazy, do you understand?  He comes home from the zoo, he wants to know if Elliot's a "war hero" like you... he wants to know how many people you killed...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: "Elliot"?  The heroic goddamn fireman?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I had to explain your tendancy to "exaggerate", How you were actually "in country" all of two weeks and how you killed about as many people as the other clerk-typists in your outfit, no more, no less...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Three weeks, Ev.  I didn't tell him I killed anybody...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Maybe not,... but you let him believe it!  And then I gotta explain about the homeless...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: The homeless!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How not all of them own apartment complexes, how not all of them play the stock market, how not all of them rent babies when they're panhandling.  He's ten years old, Bernie!  Impressionable!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Listen, it's important, Ev, I gotta see him, I got my reasons, very goddamn important...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Use the phone, Bernie, call him tomorrow, he'd like to hear from you.  Where's your other shoe? Never mind!  I don't want to know. Some fantastic adventure, right? Something really crazy.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I was giving him some advice is all. Preparing him for life.  You don't want him to grow up soft, Ev	, it's tough out there, it's a goddamn jungle.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Back to the jungle, Bernie.  Good night.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Camera, Chucky.  Are you Bernard LaPlante, sir?  What is your relationship with John Bubber?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Turn that thing off.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: How did you acquire this, Mister LaPlante?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: How do ya think I got it, for Chrissake?  Hey, put that thing down.  This is my goddamn apartment, you can't just...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What's your scheme, Mister LaPlante? What are you forcing John Bubber to do?  What are you -- ?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: For God's sake, tell him I'm on my way.  Let's go, Chucky.  A police escort is gonna pick us up en route.  You too, LaPlante.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Me!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: If you're not in the car in ten seconds, I'll have the cops pick you up.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: The cops!  What kinda bullshit is this?  Is this America or -- ?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Here!  Here... ten, thirty, fifty bucks.  How much have you got, Chucky?  Give Mister LaPlante your money.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: My fault!  My fault!  This nut case goes out on a ledge and it's my fault?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: If anything happens to John BUbber, Mister LaPlante I'm going to see you prosecuted to the full extent of the law.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: What, is everybody in love with this, bozo?  I don't get this.  What about...?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Yes, everybody <u>is</u> in love with John Bubber.  The whole country, in fact. And they're not going to be happy if he jumps to his death because he was harassed by a lousy little money-grubbing low-life fence...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: "Harassed."  Cause I yelled at him when he's riding in his limo?  The guy's a thief, he took my...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He had one <u>tiny</u>, uncharacteristic moment of weakness.  That's not the same thing as a lifetime of petty crime...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey, lady, I got faults, I know I'm not perfect but I don't get this at all, your attitude.  I saved your...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: A lifetime of petty crime climaxed by your sleaziest accomplishment yet...  blackmailing a national hero...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: -- saved your...  whaaaaaaat?  What? Blackmailing...?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You think I haven't figured it out? Just because the cops aren't on to you yet doesn't mean you're home free.  I'm a veteran reporter.  I've seen your kind before, the underbelly of crime.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Underbelly!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: In all that smoke and fire, John had a moment of weakness.  He'd been down and out, destitute, living in his car.  It was just an impulse, stealing my purse.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: All this is off the record, Chucky, because if John Bubber lives, Mister LaPlante is going to give him his assurance that there will be no more "misbehavior" on his part.  What's more he's going to apologize.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I'm going to apologize to Bubber?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I could deny I had those credit cards on the plane with me, LaPlante...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Lie, you mean...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well, maybe I wouldn't lie...but I could tell the story the way I did just now, so that people could understand that John is even more of a hero, and that you... you're the lowest thing that ever crawled.  Your name will be synonymous with cynical opportunism and blackmail.  You won't get a cent.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I got a kid, you know.  I'm a person, for Chrissake.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well, for your child's sake, show some decency then, rise above your sleazy instincts.  You may have already killed him!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I snuck in.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You media people, you think you can just go anywhere you want, spy on people.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Listen, Mister LaPlante... uh, Bernie... Who... are... you?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Who am I?  You're asking me?  You're the big expert for Chrissake!  I'm what?  The "Scumbag," right?  The sleazebag something or other, the blackmailer, the...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Was it you?  In the plane?  Who saved my life?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Me?  Listen, I don't give no interviews.  That was John Bubber. You wanna ask me questions, you could talk to my attorney, Miss O'Day.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Mister LaPlante... Bernie... I... just for a few moments... I want to be a human being, not a reporter. I'm somebody who was going to die in a burning plane and I looked up, and some man came out of the smoke, his face smeared with mud, and soot and... and he... saved my... life. Off the record.  Was it you?  Why would you deny it if it was? Because you took my purse?  Why?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: This guy, this "friend" your mother's seeing, he's a fireman, huh?  He ever... spend the night, whatsisname?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Sometimes.  His name's Elliot.  He saved a guy's life one time.  In a fire.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Oh yeah?  A hero, huh?  Was he in the 'Nam, this guy Elliot?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: "The Nomm"?  What's that?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: It was this war.  Viet Nam.  Doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Were you in it?  In the war?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You never saw that picture, huh?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What picture?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Me in my uniform.  Used to be on the bookcase.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Are you gonna take me somewhere next weekend?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I'm working on that.  It's just I got some business problems and... whatsa matter?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Here.  Get off here.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Thanks.  Thanks, pal.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Listen, buddy, I'm really enjoying this relationship we got going here. I been missing out on not knowing you better.  Thing is, I got all this business stuff...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I could go to a movie Thursday night.  'Cause we don't have school on Friday.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Here we are.  Yeah, that's a possibility.  A movie.  Now you gwan in, tell your mother I got you back on time.  Point that out to her. She was always on my case for stuff like that.  She's still like that, right?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah.  I'll see ya... dad.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, my dad's great.  He took me to the zoo.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: JOEY!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You remember where I said how I was gonna explain about life, buddy?  Well, the thing about life is...  it gets weird.  See people are always gonna be talking to you about "truth." Everybody always knows what the truth is, like it was toilet paper or something and they got a supply in the closet. But what you learn as you get older is, there ain't no truth. All there is is bullshit .  Layers of it. One layer of bullshit on top of another.  So what you do in life, like when you get older, is you pick the layer of bullshit you prefer and that's <u>your</u> bullshit, so to speak.  You got that?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Mmmmm.  Well, it's complicated. Maybe when you're older.  Anyhow, what I'm gonna tell you here is in strict confidence, okay?  It don't go no further.  What happened is, you remember that night I was gonna take you to the movies an' it was raining like a sonofabitch, ..?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Uh, er... I...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You were saying you don't want a million dollars.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Well, I'm not entitled to a million dollars.  I... I... didn't expect... I didn't expect...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: All the adulation?  It makes you feel like a fake, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Uh, actually... yes... I... should never have come forward and presented myself as --

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Instant celebrity is overwhelming to anybody.  <u>You've</u> known John Bubber all your life, you're used to him, you know you're the same human being you were before all the excitement.  So you feel like a fraud...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: ...unworthy of the adoration.  We all do.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Is she... serious?  A half a million dollars?  In my behalf?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You're a celebrity, John.  People are going to want to please you... or use you... or both.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Uh, no.  But I, uh, wonder if you could up support... support a program to help the needy and...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: John, I'm sure she could support just about anything.  I think I'll see you to your room. A sort of bodyguard.  Make sure no harm comes to you.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Uh, if you could, just, uh, support, uh, a small airfield...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: It's been sometime since, uh, I received any, uh, of that kind of, uh... attention.  A couple of... years.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Years?  There are going to be lots of... opportunities.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Gale... you're a very nice person. I wouldn't want to hurt you... in any way...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I... I know that, John...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You... you think I saved your... life.  I can't take advantage....

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You did save my life!  And it's <u>me</u>! I'd be taking advantage of <u>you</u>! I'm a reporter, John, an experienced professional...  I...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: I... no... I don't have the right... I...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No, I don't have the right.  You're a <u>news</u> <u>story</u>!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Uh, right.  A... news story.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I know the truth, John.  I'm flying in some guys from your unit in Vietnam tomorrow.  Interviewing them live on network hookup!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Vietnam!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Goodnight, John.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You were... very... inspiring.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: A script!  I thought we just walked through everything...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Read it.  It'll be fine.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Now you help me up.  Boy, you seem...  taller.  It must be psychological...  now that I know you saved my life...

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Gale!  I can't go through with this! It's... it's all wrong!'

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You're doing fine.  You didn't actually lift me though.  It was more like you supported me.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: That's not what I mean...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: There, like that.  Kind of, uh, sexy.  You can support me anytime, John.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Gale...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I just remembered.  You were talking about bodybuilding and swearing.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Bodybuilding!

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: It's not right, Gale...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It's no big deal, it just <u>looks</u> better carrying me.  Oh, you mean because I wasn't carrying my purse at the time.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: Gale!  This is for you.  I want you to know I never meant to hurt you. This will explain everything.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: John, I know all about it.

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: BUBBER
turns.text: "A little mistake"!

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No, John, you're too hard on yourself.  I've got the creep here, the guy who's...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Did you get it?  Jesus, did I say that?

turns.speaker: CHUCKY
turns.text: Yeah, I got it.  Sports training. You learn to follow the ball.  How about you do a wrap-up from up here?  I'll pan off that skyscraper over there, find you here, then reveal the drop.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What're we talking about?  Reach out for what?

turns.speaker: CHUCKY
turns.text: I told them how you were upset we didn't save the guy...
